title: The jealous lover satisfy'd All you that do to love pretend, Come lend an ear unto my song, And say no more than you intend, For therein you your selves do wrong. Tune of, The gallant youth of Gravesend.
publisher: Printed for J. Blare on London-Bridge,
notes: Verse - "There was in Bristol City fair".
Place of publication from and publication date conjectured by Wing.
Printed in four columns separated by ornamental rules with woodcuts at head of each column. Part of text in black letter.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
